fields.description: The horiz. spacing between lozenges on view issue looks correct, but in the Frother, the lozenges appear to be too close together.  Lets use the view issue spacing everywhere.
fields.summary: Lozenges have different horizontal spacing depending on view or in text input field.

fields.description: Try to render a long custom field name on the create/edit issue page. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Long custom names overlap when rendered in forms using FF3

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce, click the drop down, then move the mouse over the cogs, artifacts are left. This was previously an issue in issue nav.


See the screencast for a demo
fields.summary: Cog artifacts left in Add gadget to Dashboard dialog
Clicking dropdown arrow when dropdown menu is visible should hide dropdown (instead of having no effect)

fields.description:
Steps:
1. With JIRA 4.2 we are using "*" in red color to show it in form, but many forms are still having the old black color star.

I have till now seen it in all dashboard forms.
fields.summary: "*" for showing the compulsory entry in a form is not of consistent color in all forms.

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1.- Go to view issue.
2.- Press "." to open the dot dialog.
3.- Press "ESC" to dismiss it.
4.- [BUG] Notice that the view issue page jumps up and down when the dialog is dismissed.

I have only been able to reproduce this on Safari 4 on Windows. 

It seems to work fine on mac. This is the most obscure bug I have found so far.
fields.summary: When the dot dialog is dismissed the view issue page jumps up and down

fields.description:
# Open an issue.
# Shrink the browser until the "Create Issue" is hidden.
# Scroll the window to the right so the "Create Issue" is now displayed.
# Type 'c'. notice dialog is not create under the link. I guess this is so that the dialog is displayed when the "Create Issue" is hidden. I expect the dialog to display under the link if possible, or on the far right otherwise (e.g. if the "Create Issue" link is hidden).

!create_strange.png!
fields.summary: Create issue dialog does not renderer correctly is create issue is not on the screen.

fields.description:
Open an image attachment by on the view issue page to open it in the fancybox popup.

Then press 'a' and the assign dialog will popup behind it.  We should disable shortcuts just like we do with all other dialogs when the fancybox is open!
fields.summary: Image gallery fancy box popup doesn't disable keyboard shorcuts

fields.description:
I'm not sure what the desired behavior should be, but the current behavior doesn't feel right.

At the very least, the "jitter" of the menu whenever the user hover appears is a bug.

See screenshot.

* open up the cog menu of a subtask in the view issue page
* move the mouse a bit so that you activate a user hover
* The user hover appears _under_ the cog (*desired* user hover should be above the cog menu?) (all browsers)
* The cog menu also jitters one or two pixels when the hover appears/disappears (IE8 but not IE7)
fields.summary: user hover appears (strangely) when cog menu is also activated

fields.description: The top drop down menus, such as Issues and Administration, can grow so long that the user may need to scroll.  Sometimes the menus have scroll bars, but other times they don't.  If not and you try to scroll using your mouse/wheel/keyboard/etc the stalker bar kicks in and you can't see the menu.  Check out the attached video and screenshots.
fields.summary: Top drop down menus don't scroll consistently

fields.description:
Penny suggested I raise an issue in JDOG and let Edwin decide what to do.

A bug has been raised with Mozilla but they only have one more Beta (scheduled for October 1) before release candidates.
fields.summary: autoexpanding text fields (comment, description, environment) cause Firefox 4 to crash when you type in them
Remove all microcopy (eg. Use this picker for relative dates)

fields.description:
This is slightly timing related. To reproduce this:
# Enter a query such as labels = triaged
# Then quickly hit backspace a couple of times so you end up with labels = tri
# Then once again quickly before the auto complete has a chance to load hit ESC to defocus the input box
# Now hit 'l' to bring up the labels dialog for the current issue.

The blanket & dialog will appear correctly. However once the server returns with suggestions for the JQL autocomplete it will all of a sudden popup and popup through the blanket:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100827-n246p1fjcjakwi446ed5u9myak.png!

It's a fairly large edge case.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete can break through the blanket when a dialog is open

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Go to Administration->Custom Fields
# Start creating a new custom field, choose any type
# on the second screen with custom fields details (see screenshot) press enter in the focused 'Field Name' input
# as a result, the user is taken back to the first screen (Choose type), but the header and buttons are as in the second screen.

Seems to be broken only in IE.
fields.summary: Pressing Enter in create custom fields screen2 takes the user back to screen one with some additional weirdness (IE)

fields.description:
In DocumentIssueImpl, the equals method checks on "instanceOf Issue", whereas in IssueImpl, the check is made against "instanceOf IssueImpl". The rest of the equals method checks against the Issue Key field.

So if calling "contains" on a collection, e.g. returned from a lucene search, with an IssueImpl will return false, even if the Issue is actually logically contained. For this case, it would be better if equals() in IssueImpl would check against "instanceOf Issue" as well.
fields.summary: equals() on IssueImpl doesn't match DocumentIssueImpl

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. View any issue. Suppose user has a custom label field in its field configuration. Click on any entry of custom label field.
3. User is taken to the issue naviagtor with issue searched for custom label entry.

Result:
1. User sees the query having field ID if user default view is advanced search.

Expected:
1. End user should always see name for the fields and not the ID as they don't have any meaning for them.
fields.summary: Query string for custom label is having ID in place of name if user invoke it from view issue/issue navigator.

fields.description:
found this dialog with a whole bunch of issues...some also raised elsewhere...

- inconsistent internal padding: should be 16 pixels
- move extra text outside of message box into the box
- remove italic styling
- move command button and relabel to 'Retry'
- reduce width of dialog to 540px

see attached image.

rating as a lower priority ONLY because the user may not come across it often
fields.summary: error message dialog tweaks
DefaultJqlClauseBuilder passess null for non-null parameter

fields.description:
1) Go to the issue nav.
2) Scroll horizontally.
3) Hover over a user name that is beyond the original right-hand border of the screen.

In IE7 and FF3.0, the avatar popup appears further left than it should do. 

Edit: Retested against 4.2 final, and now it's wrong in every browser.

!AvatarMisaligned.png!
fields.summary: User avatars appear in wrong place after horizontal scrolling

fields.description:
*Steps*
1. Bring up the operations dialog.
2. Type {{sc}}.
3. Use the mouse to select the {{c}}.
4. Right-click and cut.

*Expected*
- After step 2, suggestions that match {{sc}}, e.g., 'Attach Screenshot'.
- After step 4, suggestions that match {{s}}, e.g., 'Start Progress', 'Attach Screenshot'.

*Actual*
- After step 2, suggestions that match {{sc}}, e.g., 'Attach Screenshot'.
- After step 4, suggestions that match {{sc}}, e.g., 'Attach Screenshot'.

The only cases that handle editing the query in a frother control are when you use the backspace or delete keys.
fields.summary: Frother control suggestions don't update for all update events

fields.description:
If you enter a version name > 255 characters in EditVersionDetails then you get an exception on the screen. 

(Only found this because of JRADEV-2236)
fields.summary: Edit project version allows the entry of a name that exceeds permissible database column length which results in ugly onscreen exception

fields.description:
I am grouping two related bugs into a single issue in an effort to reduce overall time/work spent over its lifetime.

To reproduce *Bug #1*:

# Go to the dashboard.
# Click an arrow to drop a navigation menu dropdown.
# Without closing the dropdown, start dragging a gadget by mousedowning on a gadget header bar.


Result:

The dropdown becomes almost-permanently shown. No actions besides hovering/clicking the original arrow target will cause it to hide again. (See attachment LayerMenu_is_broken.png.)

Expected result:

Either the layer manager should remember that the navigation menu dropdown is open and subsequent clicks on the document (after dragging the gadget) should close the menu, or initiating a drag gadget action should automatically close the menu.

To reproduce *Bug #2*:

# Go to the dashboard.
# Click a cog inside a gadget to drop a cog menu dropdown.
# Without closing the dropdown, drag the containing gadget.


Result:

The dropdown remains in its original position. (See attachment Cog_menu_doesnt_follow_gadget.png.)

Expected result:

The dropdown should either move in sync with its containing gadget, or be closed automatically before the gadget moves anywhere.
fields.summary: Dragging gadgets messes up dropdown management

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto Issue navigator/view issue page.
3. Invoke . dialog and select "attach file".
4. The focus is on "Browse" button.
5. Try pressing up/down arrow key.

Result:
1. The page in the background is moving up and down.
2. The same issue is in other dialogs also when focus is on "wiki preview" icon or help icons.
fields.summary: Pressing up/down arrow key with any dialog open scrolls the page in background if focus is on button in FF

fields.description:
This happens on JDOG for me when I try to manage my dashboards. 

!single_dashboard.png!
fields.summary: I am given the option to configure the order of my favourite dashboard even though I have only one.
Someday it would be cool if the labels field in the issue nav filter control was autosuggest

fields.description:
In response to JRADEV-2997 we now do this on the {{SetupImportAction}} to locate the import file:
# Locate the file using the path as entered by user. Relative paths will be based at Tomcat working directory. Absolute paths will be honored. If file is found then restore otherwise continue to next step.
# Locate the file using {{$JIRA.HOME/import}} as the base. For this check we strip the path from the file and just look for {{$JIRA.HOME/import/$FILE}}.

This can cause confusion if the user is trying to restore a file located using 1, but they actually restore a file using 2. For example:

# Adam has a file called {{$JIRA.HOME/import/backup.xml}}.
# Adam tires to restore {{c:\tmp\backup.xml}} when he actually meant {{c:\temp\backup.xml}}.
# [BUG] JIRA rather than returning in error restores  {{$JIRA.HOME/import/backup.xml}} without any indication this what it decided to do.

As a user I find this very strange behavior. I would expect an error or at the very least a confirmation before trying to restore {{$JIRA.HOME/import/backup.xml}} as it is not the file that I typed in. We may even want to consider skipping the {{$JIRA.HOME/import}} lookup altogether if the user types in a file with any path. Finally, it may also be useful to indicate which file JIRA was restored from both in the server log and on the import result screen.
fields.summary: Allowing SetupImport to use either "absolute path" or "JIRA.HOME" as a base to find an import file can lead to confusion.

fields.description:
There is currently no feedback at all to the user that something is wrong if they bring up the Operations Dialog and their session has timed out (or they have logged out in another window), or if the server is down.

We should display an error message telling the user to reload the page.
fields.summary: Operations dialog feedback if user logged out or timed out or server down

fields.description:
In the french heatmap gadget the number of issues is shown before the text "number of issues:". This is wrong.

!heatmap_fr.png!

Edit: seems the i18n key has been changed (new placeholder) so we need to make sure this is updated for German as well.
fields.summary: French heatmap i18n string is off

fields.description:
In every other browser, if you have a long line without spaces, it will wrap when you get to the end of the line. In FireFox 3.0, it is continuing on horizontally. This creates a horizontal scrollbar that is usually several pages away and hence inaccessible.

This is exacerbated by the new narrow AUI-style text fields that are half the width that they were in 4.1.2.

!LongLinesFF30.png!

Some sample data for the triagers:

fields.summary: Long lines scroll horizontally in text fields in FF 3.0

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto View issue page.
3. Press m to put comment or press click "comment" from down the page.
4. Without inputting any text, click "Add".

Result:
1. The user is taken to a satellite page with "comment" text box and message in it.

Expected:
1. The error message should appear inline in the view issue dialog.
fields.summary: Trying to add a blank comment on view issue page, take user to the satellite page

fields.description:
If you move an issue between two projects, where a field (e.g. components) is required in the target project, the subtasks will ignore the 'requiredness' of the field.

So if the parent issue doesn't have components set, the user will be prompted to enter a component in order for the move to work.  If the parent issue does have a component however but subtasks don't have a component then the move will succeed without the user being asked to enter a component.  The subtask will get created in the new project without the required field being entered.

This has been around for ages I'm sure!
fields.summary: Required fields for subtasks get lost on move issue operation

fields.description: !cog_align_broken_again.png!
fields.summary: Dropdown in cog menus don't position correctly in gadgets under IE.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. View any long issue.
3. Press . dialog to invoke any functionality(tested with assign, link and log work).
4. Perform certain actions like selecting options from drop down. Click <ESC> or cancel to close the dialog.

Result:
1. Check the attached screenshot. There is a addition of empty space on top of the issue. Can see this only in safari4
fields.summary: Opening any dialog thru . dialog and canceling it Add a blank space on top of issue in Safari 4 (OSX only)

fields.description:
We gave this visual treatment to the Unresolved, but did not do it for Unassigned.

Let be consistent.

fields.description:
Steps:

1.- Restore the "example.xml" backup attached to this issue.
2.- Login as "admin", "admin".
3.- Go to the issue "BAIN-2".
4.- Click on the "Two" tab.
5.- Reload the page.
6.- *[BUG]* Notice that the "Two" tab is not the selected tab anymore.

This is not consistent with the activity tabs on the view issue page which are sticky.
fields.summary: Screen Tabs should be sticky
Clicking somewhere else on the screen when dot dialog is up should close the dialog

fields.description:
..and it's even worse - neither really does it well.

Add Components always returns you to the project admin screen after you add a component.

Add versions doesn't give you the option to go back to the project management screen.

What we should do is return to the Add screen after adding a version or component and hava a finished (or done) button.
fields.summary: Add Versions and Add Components do not behave the same

I am sure there are more dialogs with the problem.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Goto Dashboard. Click "Add Gadget".


Result:
1. Focus is no where.

Expected:
1. Focus should be on "search" textbox.

fields.description:
Due to [AJS-496|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AJS-496], any ' (single quote) characters are stripped by AJS.format. This affects lots of strings in our gadgets.

For example, that the login gadget in french says "Nom dutilizateur" instead of "Nom d'utilizateur".
fields.summary: Single quotes getting stripped off i18n text in gadgets

fields.description:
Following the fixing of JRA-10863, the wording which says:
bq. Note: Please be patient when submitting this form. It may take a few minutes depending on how long it takes to export your data to a file.
should be updated as we no longer export the users data or logs.
fields.summary: The wording of the Admin / Support Request page is now out of date with the Application functionality.

fields.description:
Check the attached video. The issue is there in all browsers. Would be really interested to know for how long this is been around.

In form like edit issue form, pressing enter to view the "viewable by" entries, shift user focus on top of the page.
fields.summary: "Viewable by" dropdown position in dialog is not retaining its position and also srolling up and down moves the view issue page in background

fields.description:
Go to Administration/Priorities and change the name of one of the priorities.

Now go to advanced issue search and search for issues with the priority you just renamed. The JQL query uses the new name, but the tooltips still show the hardcoded name (e.g. Blocker). View the issue and the same thing happens.

Same goes for issue types. This is not new in 4.2.

!priority.png!
fields.summary: Priority and issue type strings hardcoded all over the place

fields.description: The Multi user picker icon does not line up with the icon on the single user picker.
fields.summary: Multi-user picker icon is slightly misaligned.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open a cog menu or FC dropdown (that's not inside a dialog -- i.e., versions/components) that is taller than the window height.
# Focus the first list item in the menu.
# Press the <up> arrow key to move focus to the last list item.
# Press the <down> arrow key to move the focus back to the first list item.
# Go to step 3.

Result:

Sometimes Safari will scroll excessively, either much higher or much lower than needed. This can cause the focused list item to not be visible within the window viewport.

Expected result:

When JavaScript automatically scrolls the page, it should always scroll the minimal amount possible.
fields.summary: Safari sometimes scrolls too much when using arrow keys to navigate through a long dropdown list

fields.description:
1. Go to Issue Nav and perform a new search (not a saved filter).
2. Click Views->On Dashboard.
3. Click Save to Dashboard.
4. *[BUG]* Notice that the keyboard focus has not been set on the first form element (the "Select Dashboard" dropdown).

This is happening in all browsers.
fields.summary: Save Search Result on Dashboard does not focus on the first form element when creating a filter based on the search result

anonymous 88x2037118x2 1rek059 /secure/QuickSearch.jspa [jira.jql.query.LikeQueryFactory] Unable to parse the text '[url=http://adderall.iforums.us/#]generic form of adderall[/url] http://valium.iforums.us/# valium no prescription order vicodin without prescription http://vicodin.iforums.us/# what is vicodin acetaminophen bitartrate hydrocodone vicodin adderall worsening desire to use alcohol [url=http://valium.iforums.us/#]what are slang names for valium[/url] [url=http://vicodin.iforums.us/#]can you liquefy vicodin[/url] clonazepam dosage for extreme anxiety cheapest adipex online [url=http://valium.iforums.us/#]valium for dogs[/url] http://redstate.com/users/oxycontin/# false positive for oxycontin phentermine no prescription cheap phentermine free shipping [url=http://hydrocodone.iforums.us/#]hydrocodone half life[/url] http://lortab.iforums.us/# does zoloft help with lortab withdrawal clonazepam fatal dose [url=http://lortab.iforums.us/#]lortab elixir[/url] http://vicodin.iforums.us/# where can i buy vicodin online http://adderall.myeweb.net/# adderall and weight loss how long can lortab be detected [url=http://valium.iforums.us/#]buy valium uk[/url] http://plone.org/author/fioricetonline# is fioricet a controlled substance adderall http://phentermine.iforums.us/# phentermine very cheap [url=http://adderall.myeweb.net/#]side effects of adderall[/url] signs of vicodin addiction withdrawal effects of oxycontin negative side effects from phentermine http://valium.iforums.us/# valium for sale http://clonazepam.iforums.us/# clonazepam and viagra interaction adipex generic does zoloft help with lortab withdrawal [url=http://adipex.iforums.us/#]success stories of adipex[/url] [url=http://adderall.myeweb.net/#]adderall meth[/url] [url=http://adipex.iforums.us/#]adipex[/url] http://clonazepam.iforums.us/# clonazepam buy mexico [url=http://xanax.iforums.us/#]xanax withdrawal drug[/url] [url=http://plone.org/author/fioricetonline#]fioricet info[/url] [url=http://xanax.iforums.us/#]buy xanax without a prescription or membership[/url] adderall high crp [url=http://valium.iforums.us/#]valium online[/url] adderall side effects apraxia< /a> [url=http://plone.org/author/fioricetonline#]fioricet does it have asprin in it[/url] what does xanax look like http://valium.iforums.us/# valium addiction http://plone.org/author/fioricetonline# discreet fioricet http://redstate.com/users/oxycontin/# allergy to oxycontin skin sensitivity http://redstate.com/users/oxycontin/# oxycontin addiction http://adipex.iforums.us/# how long does it take adipex to work [url=http://adderall.myeweb.net/#]adderall information[/url] is it legal to buy fioricet online http://clonazepam.iforums.us/# clonazepam addiction http://vicodin.iforums.us/# vicodin mexico [url=http://adderall.myeweb.net/#]drug adderall[/url] [url=http://plone.org/author/fioricetonline#]where can i buy fioricet online[/url] [url=http://adderall.myeweb.net/#]adderall half life[/url] http://lortab.iforums.us/# lortab elixir http://xanax.iforums.us/# xanax overdose [url=http: //hydrocodone.iforums.us/#]hydrocodone bitartrate and acetaminophen tablets usp ciii[/url] http://xanax.iforums.us/# how to get high on xanax [url=http://redstate.com/users/oxycontin/#]oxycontin lyrics[/url] [url=http://vicodin.iforums.us/#]will vicodin make you fail a drug test[/url] [url=http://phentermine.iforums.us/#]buy phentermine online[/url] valium used ' for field 'summary'. {noformat} It seems like our spammer friends have been targeting the QuickSearch form with this sort of content. This highlights that we should probably log this at DEBUG level as it only pollutes the logs with messages that are caused from invalid or incorrect user [or bot in this case] input. Additionally, it seems to be that we are not doing any client or server side validation of the lenght of this string. According to a conversation I had with Chris M about this the max lenght of a jql query is 3000 characters and the sample string above is 4187 characters long. We should have both client and server side validation of this. I guess this will have to be investigated to confirm all of this. It seems like the both changes, specially the logging one should be a simple fix with low-risk, so I guess it could fit into the 4.2 timeframe, but let's see what the triage team say about this.
fields.summary: QuickSearch.jspa is logging at WARN level on JAC when it can't parse queries causing excessive logging. It also seems that we are not doing validation checks on the max-lenght of this string.

fields.description:
The message generated will be similar to this:

2010-09-22 14:50:50,476 http-8080-2 WARN anonymous 890x44x1 zru4rb 127.0.0.1 /secure/AttachScreenshot!default.jspa [webwork.view.taglib.IteratorTag] Value is null! Returning an empty set.

There are many instances where this message can be printed as the iterator tag is used all over JIRA's jsps and we have no sustainable way of tracking down and making sure that we don't pass null collections to it. 

This message has no value for a system administrator, and just causes noise in the logs. Since I don't even see any debugging value in it, I propose that we remove it entirely. I have seen instances of this message in the JAC and JDOG logs. A fix should be straight-forward.
fields.summary: atlassian-webwork's iterator tag logs warning messages when the value of what it is iterating is null
DefaultCustomFieldManager has multi-threaded correctness problems

2. View any issue of decent length.
3. Scroll the issue a bit down. Through . dialog select "Link".
4. Tab to "Issues" dropdown. Press down to view all issues in history/search.

fields.description:
When we click on a permlink to comment/worklog the Activity section will be expanded, as per JRADEV-1736. Problem is that all other sections are expanded too, even if they were previously collapsed.

I think the correct behaviour would be to expand only the Activity section, and leave the others as per the cookie pref.
fields.summary: Permlinking to a comment or worklog expands all sections

I would expect the "Back To" button to redirect to where you came from. A simple solution may be to rename the button "goto issue" and then let the user use the back button in their browser.

fields.description:
See screenshot for an example.

This scroll bar disappears when you click on another tab & then come back. See screencast for an example of this.

Found while testing https://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-2803
fields.summary: Unnecessary horizontal scroll bar for long fields on IE7

fields.description:
*Steps*
# Go to an issue and click 'Close Issue.'
# Confirm that the close issue dialog has a vertical scrollbar (if not, make your viewport shorter, refresh the page, and try again).
# Click on the calendar icon of a date picker.
# Scroll the dialog with the mouse wheel.

*Expected*
- Either the date picker should scroll with the trigger, *or*
- The date picker closes itself, like the frother control dropdowns when you scroll inside a dialog.

*Actual*
- The datepicker popup stays where it originally was and ends up floating over the content of the dialog.
fields.summary: Date picker isn't anchored to trigger when scrolling inside dialogs

fields.description: please consistently align icons and form fields as illustrated on the attached screengrab.
fields.summary: vertically centre align icons and fields

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Edit an issue.
3. Focus on the labels field, hit down and select one of the labels suggested.
4. Save the issue.
5. Edit the issue.
6. Focus on the labels field and delete the label you added.
7. Hit down and you'll notice that the label deleted is no longer suggested.

This is because the suggestions are fed by an ajax request but because the label deleted during the above process hasn't actually been saved to the database it won't appear in the list of suggestions as it normally would. Not sure if this is a bug but if you do accidentally click and delete an lozenge there's no way to "reset" that field to know what was in it previously short of reloading the page. Maybe have a "recent" list of deleted ones?
fields.summary: Labels removed when editing an issue not displayed in suggestions

fields.description: Got feedback that the 14pt fonts in the filters controls on issue navigator looks funny and too big.
fields.summary: Font size in filters box

fields.description:
Pingdom reported SAC was not responding a couple of times. Investigations showed that there were a number of requests that had service times in excess of 3,000,0000 ms, some even going for 8M and 12M ms. Some of these queries had CPU burn for most of their duration, others were idle.

Some of the transaction traces:

12M seconds https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-51213
https://rpm.newrelic.com/v2/accounts/9704/applications/285017/transaction_traces/9704_1709207

8M seconds https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-51212
https://rpm.newrelic.com/v2/accounts/9704/applications/285017/transaction_traces/9704_1709207

4M seconds https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-51213
https://rpm.newrelic.com/v2/accounts/9704/applications/285017/transaction_traces/9704_1708573

3.5M seconds    https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-50869
https://rpm.newrelic.com/v2/accounts/9704/applications/285017/transaction_traces/9704_1707916
fields.summary: SAC unresponsive - New Relic showing transactions taking 3 hours + to complete
View Issue Labels & Fields

fields.description:
* Make and admin change that will require a re-index.
eg add a new Custom Field.
* Browse to http://localhost:8080/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
You will see something like
bq. Pænny made configuration changes in section 'Custom Fields' at 17/Sep/10 3:17 PM. 
* Log out of JIRA.
* Browse to http://localhost:8080/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
You can still see the details even though you are not logged in.

Expected: this data is hidden from anyone without admin privileges.
fields.summary: Admin configuration changes information is displayed to an anonymous browser

fields.description:
When the items for the operations dropdown are created we add a CSS class of the same name to the item's li. This means a user can inject CSS styles into the dropdown. For example, if you have a workflow transitions called {{small}} then this is what you get.

!workflow_css_injection.png!

# Restore [^data.xml].
# Goto issue HSP-1.
# Open the operations dialog.
fields.summary: Can inject CSS classes into the items in the operations dropown.

Bringing up a dialog removes the vertical scroll bar.  If this is enough to cause the summary to unwrap from 2 lines to 1 line, a grey area will appear.

Not surprised we missed this...
fields.summary: Stalker causes grey area is summary unwraps due v-scrollbar disappearing from dialog

fields.description:
If you post to a REST transitions resource, e.g. .../rest/api/2.0.alpha1/issue/BULK-60/transitions, to transition an issue but supply an invalid JSON string the application throws an internal server error.  It should return the correct error status.

{code}
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.util.json.JSONException: A JSONObject text must begin with '{' at character 0 of 
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.json.JSONTokener.syntaxError(JSONTokener.java:518)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.json.JSONObject.<init>(JSONObject.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.json.JSONObject.<init>(JSONObject.java:365)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueResource.doTransition(IssueResource.java:297)
{code}
fields.summary: Invalid JSON in transitions REST request causes internal server error.

fields.description:
As part of the javascript restructure can we look at better compartmentalization of responsibilities?

Shouldn't the dropdown be closing itself on click? Or some other "open layer" manager?
fields.summary: What is the popup javascript telling the dropdowns to close?

fields.description:
They keyboard shortcut "p" focuses the next comment on the view issue page. The sequence of pressing "g" then "p" is the shortcut for navigating to the current issue's project index. Executing a shortcut sequence doesn't prevent the single-key shortcut from also executing; it should.

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to the view issue page of an issue that has one or more comments.
# Press "g".
# Press "p".


Result:

Both the "twixi" link of the last comment is focused and the current project page is loaded -- i.e., actions for both "p" and \["g","p"] shortcuts are executed.

Expected result:

The twixi should not be focused, but the current project page should be loaded -- i.e., only the \["g","p"] shortcut should be executed.
fields.summary: Sequenced keyboard shortcuts don't mute other shortcuts assigned to the same key

fields.description:
h5. Steps

# Create a comment.
# Switch to preview mode. Note that the preview "image" remains the same. 

|!edit_mode.png!|!preview_mode.png!|

I would expect the image to change to imply the toggle.
fields.summary: The preview button does not toggle.

fields.summary: Calendar plugin throws exception on JAC

fields.description: so you have no idea what language to pick if you pick the incorrect language.
fields.summary: Language name shown in current locale rather than the locale of the language

fields.description:
If you navigate to a page of the issue nav that is off the end of the list, the heading displays "Displaying issues 0 to 15 of 15 matching issues." but no issues are shown.

Quick way to reproduce: 
* Go to https://jdog.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?pager/start=350000

How a customer would encounter this:
* Go to page 10 of a search in a browser window.
* In another tab, do another search that returns < 10 pages of results.
* In the first tab, refresh the page.

!IssueNavPaging.png!
fields.summary: Issue nav paging behaves oddly if you run off the end of the list

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA as admin.
2. Goto Admin-> Mail Servers. Click "Configure new SMTP mail server"

Result:
1. Focus is nowhere in the form.

Expected:
1. The focus should be on the "name " field.
fields.summary: Focus is nowhere when user click "Configure new SMTP mail server" .

fields.description:
suggest replacing message on drop down with "Existing label" or something similar that describes the state.

see screen shot
fields.summary: unhelpful message when entering duplicate labels: 'no matches'

fields.description:
1) Bring up the Issue Nav and perform a new search (not a saved filter)
2) Click Views->On Dashboard
3) Click Save to Dashboard.
4) *[BUG] Notice the amount of whitespace in the bottom and the right of the dialog. See screenshot
fields.summary: Save Search Result on Dashboard has an excessive amount of whitespace on the bottom and the right of the dialog which creates a new filter

fields.description: Suggest changing the form to issue-link to avoid conflicts and bring it inline with issue-edit.
fields.summary: ID clash between ops bar Link Issue button and the Link Issue form in the dialog

fields.description:
* On dashboard add a Filter Results gadget
* Edit it
* The "Columns to display" multi-select box has a scrollbar which is not operable via mouse (dragging or clicking below it).
However, using scrollwheel or selecting an item and using down-arrow key seems fine.
fields.summary: Scrollbar on edit Filter Results Gadget does not work

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. View any issue.
3. Open any operation dialog like assign, link...
4. Add some text in comment field and select wiki preview icon.(use keyboard for everything).
5. Now submit the form.

Result:
1. On clicking "Submit" button, an extra line is added in comment field.
fields.summary: Trying to submit any dialog with comments in wiki preview mode, add extra line in IE 7.0

fields.description: There should be some indication, as is the case for other issue actions executed from the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Convert to Subtask (from the issue navigator) takes the user back to the issue navigator but gives no indication that anything has happened.

fields.description:
When configuring _Update Issue Field Function_ post function on a workflow transition, tabbing to the text box doesn't automatically select the respective checkbox (that chooses b/w Automatic and a field value). Clicking in the text box does update the checkbox.

Look at [^edit postfunction.swf] to see what I mean.
fields.summary: tabbing to text box doesn't update check box (clicking does)

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Click on "Issues" to goto issue naviagtor.
3. Select an issue and thru . dialog clone it.

Result:
1. Once the issue is clone, the message on top says "XXX is cloned". No reference to the newly created issue.
2. As a user if I am cloning issue, I am interested in a new one, without any indication or issue number....its quite difficult to search for the newly created issue.
fields.summary: Usability: User doesn't get any info about the newly created issue if cloning an issue from issue navigator.

fields.description:
when set to unknown:

Versions fields use bolded text and Component does not.
Make the Component field bold also

Also the baseline alignment of the Component label and value is off.
Please fix

See attached screen grab.
fields.summary: edit issue: use consistent bolding and fix alignment on unknown values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22700].
  {panel}

1. goto the Navigator
2. select Manage Columns from the Tools menu
3. click on the oauth link in the left panel
4. resulting page is weird style leftover
fields.summary: oath page uses old or wierd page template

fields.description: Long input into the Frother Control produces overflowing lozenges. The long text inside lozenges should be cut off and 'ellispsized'. This affects basically all FCs (label-, version-, component-, issue pickers) and labels on the view issue. Screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Frother Control doesn't handle long 'lozenges'
Ellipsis is cutoff in IE8 when there's a long first entry in the list to be shortened

fields.description: Open up the quick create issue dialog (top right corner), trigger any of the drop-downs and hover over it for a while (~5 seconds). The dialog will disappear and has to be reopened. This might be confusing in cases where there are many projects/issue types and it takes time to choose the correct one.
fields.summary: IE - Quick create issue dialog disappears while choosing a project / issue type
